title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Supply Chain Managers

content.rendered:
What is a Supply Chain Manager?

Supply Chain Managers and specialists manage relations with external partners to select and purchase material to produce a company’s products. As client-facing representatives of a company, they’re also responsible for negotiating contracts and working with multiple suppliers.

Where does a Supply Chain Manager work?

  • Manufacturing companies
  • Aerospace companies
  • Large and small office spaces

How much does a Supply Chain Manager make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Supply Chain Manager is $64,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Supply Chain Managers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Business majors
  • Logistics majors
  • Industrial engineering majors
Search Supply Chain Manager jobs on Handshake

Supply Chain Manager skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Supply Chain Managers succeed in their work:

  • Good project management skills
  • Knowledge of e-business and procurement
  • Leadership and teamwork skills

What are some common questions about Supply Chain Managers?

Q: What does a SCM intern do?

A: As a supply chain intern you’ll work closely with Supply Chain Managers–assisting them with day-to-day operational needs.
